slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः | तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ||
slokas.pronunciation: arjuna uvācha | ye śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥ | teṣhāṁ niṣhṭhā tu kā kṛiṣhṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Arjuna inquired: O Krishna, what is the situation of those who do not follow the principles of scripture but worship according to their own imagination? Are they in goodness, in passion or in ignorance?

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा | सात्त्विकी राजस चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī-bhagavān uvācha | tri-vidhā bhavati śhraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā | sāttvikī rājasī chaiva tāmasī cheti tāṁ śhṛiṇu ||
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: According to the modes of nature acquired by the embodied soul, one's faith can be of three kinds – in goodness, in passion or in ignorance. Now hear about this.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत | श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ||
slokas.pronunciation: sattvānurūpā sarvasya śhraddhā bhavati bhārata | śhraddhā-mayo 'yaṁ puruṣho yo yach-chhraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Bharata, according to one's existence under the various modes of nature, one evolves a particular kind of faith. The living being is said to be of a particular faith according to the modes he has acquired.

slokas.sanskrit: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः | प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ||
slokas.pronunciation: yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣha-rakṣhānsi rājasāḥ | pretān bhūta-gaṇānśh chānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Men in the mode of goodness worship the demigods; those in the mode of passion worship the demons; and those in the mode of ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.

slokas.sanskrit: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः | दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: aśhāstra-vihitaṁ ghoraṁ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ | dambhāhaṅkāra-sanyuktāḥ kāma-rāga-balānvitāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Those who undergo severe austerities and penances not recommended in the scriptures, performing them out of pride and egoism, who are impelled by lust and attachment,

slokas.sanskrit: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः | मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ||
slokas.pronunciation: karṣhayantaḥ śharīra-sthaṁ bhūta-grāmam achetasaḥ | māṁ chaivāntaḥ śharīra-sthaṁ tān viddhy āsura-niśhchayān ||
slokas.meaning: who torture the material elements of the body and also Me who dwells within it – know such demons to be of demoniac resolves.

slokas.sanskrit: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः | यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ||
slokas.pronunciation: āhāras tv api sarvasya tri-vidho bhavati priyaḥ | yajñas tapas tathā dānaṁ teṣhāṁ bhedam imaṁ śhṛiṇu ||
slokas.meaning: Even the food each person prefers is of three kinds, according to the three modes of material nature. The same is true of sacrifices, austerities and charity. Now hear of the distinctions between them.

slokas.sanskrit: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः | रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ||
slokas.pronunciation: āyuḥ-sattva-balārogya-sukha-prīti-vivardhanāḥ | rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛidyā āhārāḥ sāttvika-priyāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Foods dear to those in the mode of goodness increase the duration of life, purify one's existence and give strength, health, happiness and satisfaction. Such foods are juicy, fatty, wholesome, and pleasing to the heart.

slokas.sanskrit: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः | आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ||
slokas.pronunciation: kaṭv-amla-lavaṇāty-uṣhṇa- tīkṣhṇa-rūkṣha-vidāhinaḥ | āhārā rājasasyeṣhṭā duḥkha-śhokāmaya-pradāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry and burning are dear to those in the mode of passion. Such foods cause distress, misery and disease.

slokas.sanskrit: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् | उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣhitaṁ cha yat | uchchhiṣhṭam api chāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam ||
slokas.meaning: Food prepared more than three hours before being eaten, food that is tasteless, decomposed and putrid, and food consisting of remnants and untouchable things is dear to those in the mode of darkness.

slokas.sanskrit: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते | यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ||
slokas.pronunciation: aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yajño vidhi-driṣhṭo ya ijyate | yaṣhṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Of sacrifices, the sacrifice performed according to the directions of scripture, as a matter of duty, by those who desire no reward, is of the nature of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् | इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: abhisandhāya tu phalaṁ dambhārtham api chaiva yat | ijyate bharata-śhreṣhṭha taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam ||
slokas.meaning: But the sacrifice performed for some material benefit, or for the sake of pride, O chief of the Bharatas, you should know to be in the mode of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् | श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ||
slokas.pronunciation: vidhi-hīnam asṛiṣhṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣhiṇam | śhraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ parichakṣhate ||
slokas.meaning: Any sacrifice performed without regard for the directions of scripture, without distribution of prasādam [spiritual food], without chanting of Vedic hymns and remunerations to the priests, and without faith is considered to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् | ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: deva-dwija-guru-prājña- pūjanaṁ śhaucham ārjavam | brahmacharyam ahinsā cha śhārīraṁ tapa uchyate ||
slokas.meaning: The worship of the Supreme Lord, the brāhmaṇas, the spiritual master, and superiors like the father and mother, and cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy and nonviolence are called austerity of the body.

slokas.sanskrit: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् | स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: anudvega-karaṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ cha yat | svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ chaiva vāṅ-mayaṁ tapa uchyate ||
slokas.meaning: Speech that causes no disturbance, that is truthful, pleasant and beneficial, and regular recitation of Vedic literature, this is called austerity of speech.

slokas.sanskrit: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः | भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥ | bhāva-sanśhuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam uchyate ||
slokas.meaning: And satisfaction, simplicity, gravity, self-control and purification of one's existence are the austerities of the mind.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः | अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥ | aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ parichakṣhate ||
slokas.meaning: This threefold austerity, performed with transcendental faith by men not expecting material benefits but engaged only for the sake of the Supreme, is called austerity in goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् | क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena chaiva yat | kriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ chalam adhruvam ||
slokas.meaning: Penance performed out of pride and for the sake of gaining respect, honor and worship is said to be in the mode of passion. It is neither stable nor permanent.

slokas.sanskrit: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः | परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ | parasyotsādanārthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛitam ||
slokas.meaning: Penance performed out of foolishness, with self-torture, or to destroy or injure others, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे | देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate 'nupakāriṇe | deśhe kāle cha pātre cha tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛitam ||
slokas.meaning: Charity given out of duty, without expectation of return, at the proper time and place, and to a worthy person is considered to be in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः | दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśhya vā punaḥ | dīyate cha parikliṣhṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam ||
slokas.meaning: But charity performed with the expectation of some return, or with a desire for fruitive results, or in a grudging mood, is said to be charity in the mode of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते | असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: adeśha-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaśh cha dīyate | asat-kṛitam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam ||
slokas.meaning: And charity performed at an impure place, at an improper time, to unworthy persons, or without proper attention and respect is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः | ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ||
slokas.pronunciation: oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśho brahmaṇas tri-vidhaḥ smṛitaḥ | brāhmaṇās tena vedāśh cha yajñāśh cha vihitāḥ purā ||
slokas.meaning: From the beginning of creation, the three words om tat sat were used to indicate the Supreme Absolute Truth. These three symbolic representations were used by brāhmaṇas while chanting the hymns of the Vedas and during sacrifices for the satisfaction of the Supreme.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्माद् ॐ इत्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः | प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: tasmād oṁ ity udāhṛitya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ | pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām ||
slokas.meaning: Therefore, transcendentalists undertaking performances of sacrifice, charity and penance in accordance with scriptural regulations begin always with om, to attain the Supreme.

slokas.sanskrit: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः | दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ||
slokas.pronunciation: tad ity anabhisandhāya phalaṁ yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ | dāna-kriyāśh cha vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣha-kāṅkṣhibhiḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Without desiring fruitive results, one should perform various kinds of sacrifice, penance and charity with the word tat. The purpose of such transcendental activities is to get free from material entanglement.

slokas.sanskrit: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते | प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve cha sad ity etat prayujyate | praśhaste karmaṇi tathā sach-chhabdaḥ pārtha yujyate ||
slokas.meaning: The Absolute Truth is the objective of devotional sacrifice, and it is indicated by the word sat. The performer of such sacrifice is also called sat, as are all works of sacrifice, penance and charity which, true to the absolute nature, are performed to please the Supreme Person, O son of Pritha.

slokas.sanskrit: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते | कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ||
slokas.pronunciation: yajñe tapasi dāne cha sthitiḥ sad iti chochyate | karma chaiva tad-arthīyaṁ sad ity evābhidhīyate ||
slokas.meaning: And faithfulness in sacrifice, penance and charity is called sat, and action for the sake of the Supreme is also called sat.

slokas.sanskrit: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् | असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||
slokas.pronunciation: aśhraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛitaṁ cha yat | asad ity uchyate pārtha na cha tat pretya no iha ||
slokas.meaning: Anything done as sacrifice, charity or penance without faith in the Supreme, O son of Pritha, is impermanent. It is called asat and is useless both in this life and the next.
